author: Merrilees Parker
method: Put the daal in a heavy-based saucepan, pour in 750ml/1pt 7fl oz water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat then simmer for about one hour, or until the lentils are really soft. Heat the oil in a large pan.  Add the mustard seeds, turmeric, cumin, asafoetida or fennel seeds, ginger, chillies and curry leaves and fry for 2-3 minutes.   when the daal is cooked add to the pan and stir in the spinach and spring onions.   Heat for a further two minutes, season, then serve.
ingredients: 225g/8oz moong daal (yellow split lentils),  750ml/1pt 7fl oz water,  2-3 tbsp sunflower or vegetable oil,  1 tsp black mustard seeds,  ¼ tsp ground turmeric,  ¼ tsp ground cumin,  ¼ tsp asafoetida or fennel seeds,  2 tbsp grated fresh ginger,  2 green chillies, de-seeded and chopped,  8 curry leaves,  100g/3½ oz spinach,  2 spring onions, trimmed and chopped
